text: Does the upload command work as expected?
You can file an issue at <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-tools|https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-tools>

I believe the field path would be the field name (if it is a top level field) or would follow dot notation if it was a child of group (e.g. parent.child). We switched boilerplate to still include IDs but the IDs follow the path of the field if you need a reference. Here is an example where this field is referring (<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/master/src/modules/card-section.module/fields.json#L9>) to this field (<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/master/src/modules/card-section.module/fields.json#L26>).

Resources for those coming here after the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/cms-cli-replacing-ftp|FTP sunset announcement>.
• <https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/getting-started|Quickstart guide to developing on the HubSpot CMS> 
• <https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/getting-started-with-local-development|Getting Started with local development> - If you are familiar with the CMS but new to the CLI(still recommend the quickstart if you’re new to Themes and the other new functionality)
• <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/developer-reference/local-development-cms-cli|CMS CLI Commands>
• <https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/creating-an-efficient-development-workflow|Creating an efficient development workflow>
• <https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/github-integration|Set up Continuous integration with GitHub> :github:
